snippet: Officers said they were protesting official pressure to crack down on demonstrators and public demands for restraint.
abstract: Thousands of Egyptian security officers strike in cities around country to protest conflicting pressures from government to crack down on street demonstrations and from public to exercise restraint; police revolt marks new complication in three-way struggle pitting security forces against Pres Mohamed Morsi on one side and against mobs of protestors on other.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh and Tara Todras Whitehall contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officers said they were protesting official pressure to crack down on demonstrators and public demands for restraint.

headline.seo: Angry at Public and Officials, Police Strike in Egypt
headline.main: Angry at Public and Officials, Security Forces Strike in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Angry at Public And Officials, Security Forces Strike in Egypt
